result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel B Ruehmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs/fees are due immediately or 10 days County Jail - defendant can't pay so the defendant will serve the 10 days to take care of financial obligation.
.

.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with the defendant's current Vernon Co. sentence
.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel B Ruehmann

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
2:45 pm Def in court and appears by phone.  Atty Araysa Marie Simpson.  Def in custody.  Justine L Suleski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Simpson:  I e-mailed Ms. Suleski about the recommendations but didn't get a response.  We would ask that the diversion not be revoked.  Def is doing an AODA and anger management in prison.  He's there for 3 years... It's my understanding that if it's revoked, it would be concurrent time.  I don't know how the court wants to proceed.  Suleski:  The time line was charges filed in Jan. 2016.  The Vernon Co. charges came in Dec., 2016.  The offense date was Apr., 2016 but the charges were filed after the diversion was filed.  He needed to tell Ms. Hickey of the new charges but didn't.  Simpson:  I don't know if he's obligated to disclose new charges.
Court:  What portion of the diversion agreement was violated?  Why do you belive the failure to notify- has he been in custody on bond prior to the conviction and sentence?
Mr. Ruehmann states he was in custody until the day I was sentenced.  Simpson:  I know one of the things they say he violated was the no alcohol.  Suleski:  It looks like he was released on a signature bond.  I can look at that more closely.  If he wasn't in custody until May of this year- the other things he was supposed to do-   Court:  I'm looking at the Vernon Co. case.  The complaint was filed Dec. 6th and the initial appearance was Dec 27th.  A signature bond was signed that same day.... The Info. was filed Jan. 6th and the PH was Jan. 30th.  Def states he wasn't locked up until June 19th.  Suleski:  He didn't do the AODA and DV assessment.... I do think there are grounds to revoke.  Simpson:  He is doing those exact things...
COURT:  The amended motion to revoke alleges several violations....  I'm understanding he was out of custody until June, 2017.  Those were not completed...  He didn't ask Ms. Hickey for any concessions... I'll find there was a violation of the diversion agreement and he made no attempt to communicate with Ms. Hickey.  THE MOTION TO REVOKE IS GRANTED.
Simpson hasn't discussed the recommendations with him but I think he'll be okay with a concurrent sentence.
Court:  Is there a victim notification issue?
Suleski:  The victim did not request notice of hearings....   Recommends concurrent jail would be appropriate.
Court:  Mr. Ruehmann, I granted the request to revoke.  The State is recommending concurrent time.  You have a couple of options.  1) you can ask for a continuance or 2) we can resolve it today.
Ruehmann:  There's no excuse for not following through with this...  I'm okay with a concurrent sentence.
SENTENCE:  120 days CJ - concurrent with his current Vernon Co. sentence.   CC: $443 to be paid immediately or 10 days CJ - he can't pay so the 10 days will take care of that.

NA by def - Atty Simpson pres - just appointed requests continuance
DPAH 9-26-17 @ 1:30 (SLH)
Araysa Simpson
GLD: Request for attorney--rescheduled.

3:49 pm Def in court by phone.  Noel A Lawrence appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court:  Mr. Ruehmann is in prison for murder.  State's motion to revoke diversion agreement.  Def would like a public defender.  State would like to proceed with the motion to revoke.
Court will continue matter for Mr. Ruehmann to get counsel.  I can't set a hearing now that will work for the prison.
CC:  8/24 at 1:30 pm    RAG      (This is to get an attorney on board.  Def need not appear)
